forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Areas Of Fog
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog after midnight. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind 10 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Fog then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog before 9am. Mostly sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 9 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As the twilight settles softly over Downtown San Francisco, the city is shrouded in a delicate blanket of fog, which has rolled in after midnight, lending a mysterious air to the expansive neighborhoods. The evening whispers of a mild 56 degrees, accompanied by a west-southwest breeze that dances between ten and twenty miles per hour, bringing with it a rustle of leaves and a promise of cooler air. Look closely, and you might find the fog clinging to the edges of the Golden Gate, draping the span in an ethereal embrace, while the more industrious parts of the city stand resolutely clear in contrast.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, anticipate the early remnants of fog lifting by nine, yielding to the brilliance of a mostly sunny day. The temperature will rise to a comfortable near 70, gradually receding to around 67 as afternoon shadows lengthen. The wind will continue its playful trajectory, gusting up to 26 miles per hour. It’s a perfect invitation for a leisurely stroll through the parks, where the world seems simultaneously expansive and intimate. To stay comfortably attired, consider layers; a light jacket is advisable for the early hours, giving way to a simple tee shirt or a breathable blouse as the day unfolds to its sunny peak. Take the moment to wander the streets, perhaps indulging in a quiet coffee at a corner café, or simply pausing to appreciate the beauty of the fog and sunlight intermingling—a canvas of urban life at its finest.
